headline.main: TANKS STILL ISSUE AT TRIAL IN RIOM; Prosecution Tries to Prove Delays in Production Caused France's inferiority DEFENSE BLAMES ARMY Gen. Langlois Says the League of Nations Poisoned Atmosphere With Talk of Peace

lead_paragraph: RIOM, France, April 1 -- The prosecution fought incessantly throughout today's debates before the Supreme Court over the question of the numbers of tanks and armored vehicles engaged in the Battle of France by the French and Germans.
abstract: Daladier agrees with Col Perre testimony on French tank output; clashes with Blum on delay; Gen Langlois testifies; Gamelin clashes with Keller as former is accused of overlooking armament deficiencies
snippet: RIOM, France, April 1 -- The prosecution fought incessantly throughout today's debates before the Supreme Court over the question of the numbers of tanks and armored vehicles engaged in the Battle of France by the French and Germans....

byline.original: By LANSING WARRENBy Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES
